Posts.Content: johnson38 wrote: Hi! I’m going stir crazy waiting for appointment date. I found swollen supraclavicular lymph node on the right side a month ago, and have been having significant tenderness in that same side breast. There are noticeable differences like dipping or caving in and I had a breast exam after being checked for infections and metabolic panel came back clear. Going to diagnostic mammogram the day after thanksgiving and also having ultrasound on right breast. Time seems to have come to a complete stop! I go about my day but into is always right there in the back of my mind. My husband is typically very supportive but has shut down since the possibility of BC came up. I don’t want to worry others until i have more answers so I was very thankful to have found this site. Just saying this little bit here makes me feel better Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Swollen nodes and breast changes johnson38 KBeee

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2017 07:29AM - edited Nov 18, 2017 07:29AM by johnson38 Only on the right side. One in clavicle area and one under arm
Posts.Title: Swollen nodes and breast changes johnson38 KBeee

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2017 06:37AM johnson38 wrote: This was my report: FINDINGS: Full-field digital mammograms of both breast in the CC and MLO projections with CAD Heterogeneously dense fibroglandular tissues noted throughout both breasts which may obscure detection of small masses. No suspicious mass. No worrisome calcifications.No architectural distortion. No primary or secondary signs of malignancy. No significant interval change since previous mammogram. Right breast ultrasound is negative.
Posts.Title: Swollen nodes and breast changes johnson38 KBeee

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2017 04:52PM johnson38 wrote: I will, getting more anxious with each passing day. The node isn’t going down and it is consuming my days at this point. I am taking friends with me In case the radiologist report is not desirable. Very hard to keep from looking at “Dr. Google” but I know better because it will cause more issues. The only consoling thought is that I will know that day if I need more testing as our hospital offers patients immediate results on diagnostic exams.
Posts.Title: Swollen nodes and breast changes johnson38 KBeee

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2017 03:54PM johnson38 wrote: Testing was completed today, I didn’t get a report except it “all looked negative” on mammogram. The radiologist uploaded a letter to my account that the mammogram detected no obvious cancer and also noted that I have dense breast tissue. All good...just waiting to see what my doctor says after reading the full report. Hoping there’s is an answer in there somewhere for the swollen nodes.
Posts.Title: Swollen nodes and breast changes johnson38 KBeee

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2017 08:45AM johnson38 wrote: My doctor hasn’t called me yet, I’m seriously considering a second opinion at a breast center that does 3D imaging because of the density.
Posts.Title: Swollen nodes and breast changes johnson38 KBeee

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2017 10:52AM johnson38 wrote: It never hurts to get a second opinion. There are many places that offer second opinions to confirm results whether you have tested positive or negative for BC. Hope you get the answers you are looking for! Hugs
